data.title: 8 Offbeat Films That Get Me Right In the Feel Goods

data.text:
Feel-good movies. We all have our favourites and it has certainly carved out a genre-like niche in the pantheon of cinema. The brilliant thing about this category though is it suffers not from the constraints of genre. The setting, the characters, the period, these factors don’t have to evoke familiar tropes, or even subvert them. What we are dealing with here, in my opinion, is narrative magic in its purest form.

What constitutes a feel-good film can be deeply personal. If there is an abiding feature it is that of the aforementioned magic. The ability of a movie to connect with something genuinely heartfelt within us, something life-affirming and soul-nourishing. That is the crux of the criteria here, though I have chosen films that do this in an off-kilter, less obviously edifying way.

The following are films that I return to. They manage to say something about the truly important and resonant matters of existence, often very simply, movingly and sometimes with humour. They also get me right in the feels, though this is sometimes achieved in unusual and unexpected ways.
